meanings.definition: To come out from a source
meanings.sent1: The light seemed to emanate from the glowing lantern.
meanings.sent2: The pleasant aroma emanated from the freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: The music notes decided to emanate from the piano all by themselves!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to emanate from every pore of her being.
meanings.sent5: The laughter emanated joy and warmth throughout the room.

meanings.sent1: The sun emanated warmth on the chilly morning.
meanings.sent2: The flowers emanated a sweet fragrance in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to emanate purrs of contentment all day long.
meanings.sent4: His confidence emanated like a bright light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The campfire emanated a comforting glow in the darkness.
